metadata.case_name: Baburao Bagaji Karemore & Ors. v. Govind Ramji Shende & Ors.

facts.text: Govind Ramji Shende declared elected as member of Maharashtra Legislative Assembly from Bhandara general constituency on March 11, 1972.
Fifteen persons filed nomination papers by February 8, 1972; scrutinised and accepted on February 9, 1972; eleven withdrew by February 11, 1972, leaving four contestants.
Candidates: Shende (independent) polled 41,511 votes; Tirpude (Congress R) 24,224; third (Republican Party Khobragade Group) 3,585; fourth (Republican Party Gaikwad Group) 564.

Four electors including first petitioner Baburao Bagaji Karemore filed joint election petition challenging Shende's election on grounds of corrupt practices under s.100 read with s.123(1-6) and contravention of s.127A of Representation of the People Act, 1951.
Petitioners alleged Shende failed to keep separate correct accounts of election expenditure as per s.77 and r.86; suppressed items exceeding Rs.12,000 limit including petrol, vehicles, printing etc.
Alleged agents M.T. Dalal, Shivshankar Ninave, Kharabe, Wagner, Ramaji Gaidhane incurred unauthorised expenses not shown in return.

On February 18, 1972, Jambuwantrao Dhote at meeting at Shahid Maidan, Bhandara, made false statement that Tirpude bribed Karemore Rs.60,000 to withdraw, in presence and with consent of Shende; published in Bhandara Times with consent.
Shende printed pamphlets/posters appealing on caste/community grounds, e.g., to Kunbi and Teli voters.
Shende denied all allegations of corrupt practices, unauthorised expenses, false statements, communal appeals.
High Court framed 31 issues, dismissed petition holding no corrupt practices proved; total expenses Rs.10,741.96 within Rs.12,000 limit; awarded costs to Shende Rs.14,400 counsel fee.
High Court added Rs.2,992.95 petrol from Exts.86,87 to Rs.7,499.11, but rejected other additions like truck illumination, tractor hire, cycles, Kirti Hotel Rs.1,959.
Even adding further disputed items Rs.3,655 (Bhan Dalal Rs.1,939, Hari salary Rs.100, Sakhare Rs.695, petrol Rs.192, taxi Rs.600, Shende Rs.129), total Rs.11,154 within limit.
No proof Dhote made false statement with Shende's consent or knowledge; witnesses not present at meeting.
Pamphlets Exts.42,43 (appeals to Kunbi/Teli voters) not proved printed/published/distributed by/with consent of Shende or agent.

legal_issues.text: Whether Shende committed corrupt practice u/s 123(6) by incurring/authorising expenditure in contravention of s.77, exceeding Rs.12,000 limit.
Whether false statements of fact u/s 123(4) made by Dhote with Shende's consent relating to character/conduct of Tirpude/Karemore.
Whether communal appeals u/s 123(3) via pamphlets Exts.42,43 printed/published/distributed by/with consent of Shende.

petitioner_arguments.text: Shende suppressed expenses on petrol, vehicles, printing, etc., exceeding Rs.12,000; agents like Dalal, Ninave incurred unauthorised expenses.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.77, r.86 Conduct of Election Rules; s.123(6) RP Act

petitioner_arguments.text: Dhote made false bribe allegation at Feb 18 meeting with Shende's consent; published in Bhandara Times as agent.
Pamphlets Exts.42,43 appealed to caste (Kunbi/Teli) voters against Tirpude; printed at Bharat Seva Press, distributed via agents.

respondent_arguments.text: All expenses correctly shown; total within limit; no unauthorised agents or suppressions.
No knowledge/consent to Dhote's statement; not present at meeting; Bhandara Times not agent.
Pamphlets not printed/published/distributed by/with consent; manufactured post-election; printer Gupta agent of rival.

court_reasoning.text: Expenses: High Court rightly rejected unreliable evidence on truck/tractor/cycles/Kirti Hotel; added Rs.2,992.95 petrol but even with further items total Rs.11,154 < Rs.12,000; no corrupt practice u/s 123(6).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Expenses well within limit even on petitioners' contentions.

court_reasoning.text: False statement: No proof Dhote made statement with Shende's consent/knowledge; witnesses unreliable; quasi-criminal charge requires strict proof.

Pamphlets: Evidence of meetings, printer unreliable; PW40/Bhole changed loyalties; PW35/Gupta polling agent of rival, no declaration u/s 127A, post-election letters deny printing; High Court findings on demeanour not perverse.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Not printed/published/distributed with consent; possibility of post-poll manufacture.

court_reasoning.text: Corrupt practices quasi-criminal; onus on petitioners to prove ingredients strictly.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Double consequence: set aside election + 6-year disqualification.

holdings.text: No corrupt practice u/s 123(6); expenses within Rs.12,000 limit.
No false statement u/s 123(4) with consent.
No communal appeal u/s 123(3) via pamphlets.

precedents_cited.citation: C.A. No. 1014 of 1972 decided on September 28, 1973
precedents_cited.relevance: Appellate court interference with trial court findings on witness demeanour; costs in election petitions.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Corrupt practices, accounts of election expenses, printing pamphlets, appeal procedure.

statutes_cited.name: Conduct of Election Rules
statutes_cited.relevance: Maintenance of accounts of election expenditure.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court upheld High Court dismissal of election petition; no corrupt practices proved under ss.123(3),(4),(6); expenses within limit; no interference with trial court findings warranted.
outcome.relief_granted: None; High Court costs to respondent upheld except counsel fee reduced as no proof of payment.
outcome.costs: High Court costs to first respondent affirmed but Rs.400 per diem counsel fee disallowed for lack of proof; no new fee certificate allowed.

key_quotes.text: In examining the question whether the allegations about the commission of corrupt practices by a returned candidate, the Court has to keep in view that the allegations about the commission of corrupt practices are of a quasi-criminal nature, the proof whereof has a double consequence of not only setting aside the election of the returned candidate, but also imposing subsequent disqualification debarring him from becoming a candidate at any election for a period of 6 years.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Emphasises strict standard of proof for corrupt practices.

key_quotes.text: Even if the contention of the petitioner is accepted... the several items will amount to Rs. 3,655/-. If these amounts are added to the election expenses already shown, it would come to Rs. 11,154. Even on this reckoning, the election expenses are well within the limit of Rs. 12,000/-
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Concludes expenses within limit even accepting petitioners' claims.
